The **scroll of time** is a type of [scroll](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") that was introduced in *[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack")*. When read, this scroll grants you a large number of movement points.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 Messages](#Messages)
- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), this is a rare scroll, just a little more common than a [scroll of genocide](/wiki/Scroll_of_genocide "Scroll of genocide")[\[1\]](#cite_note-1). In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), the probability is the same as a scroll of genocide.

[Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") have a random chance of starting with this scroll.

## Description

Reading a scroll of any [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude") will [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") it. Monsters will not read this scroll. The effects when read depend on the scroll's [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude"), including [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") readings:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

| Beatitude | Effect                                                                | Confused effect                |
| --------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------ |
| Blessed   | 75 movement points (effectively 6.25 more turns)Uses 30-59 nutrition. | Paralyzes you for 5-9 turns.   |
| Uncursed  | 50 movement points (effectively 4.2 more turns).Uses 30-59 nutrition. | Paralyzes you for 10-14 turns. |
| Cursed    | Paralyze you for 15-19 turns.                                         | Paralyze you for 15-19 turns.  |

For reference, a normal-speed turn is 12 movement points.

In SpliceHack, the scroll sets the movement points for *your next turn* to the above amount. Note that this could give a monster (ie: [Pestilence](/wiki/Pestilence "Pestilence")) the extra turn they need to kill you *now*. Reading multiple scrolls of time also will not stack for the current turn, **your next turn** will always be the benefit of extra movement points.

## Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), the behavior of the scroll of time is altered slightly in the player's favor. When read, the scroll adds to your current movement points and *extends the current turn.*[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) In contrast to SpliceHack, when you read a non-cursed, non-confused scroll with a nasty next to you, you are guaranteed some time to act. The scroll also costs 300 instead of 100.

However, a few restrictions have been added to make them very rare and prevent abuse of the time mechanic:

- Scrolls of time can only be found in the wild or in [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones").
- They cannot be written via [magic markers](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker").
- They cannot be cloned via a [scroll of cloning](/wiki/Scroll_of_cloning "Scroll of cloning").
- They cannot be created as a result from [polypiling](/wiki/Polypiling "Polypiling").

## History

The scroll of was introduced in [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") and continued into the SpliceHack rewrite. It was later ported to [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

## Messages

- You are frozen in time!

  You read a cursed or confused scroll of time.

- ZA WARUDO!

  You read a non-cursed scroll of time while hallucinating.

- Time slows down to a crawl around you!

  You read a non-cursed scroll of time.

- The scroll violently resists the cloning process!

  You tried to clone a scroll of time.

- You cannot write an illusion!

  You tried to write a scroll of time.
